alert.note: Alert for Amherst; Buckingham (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 5:02PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHERN APPOMATTOX...SOUTHWESTERN BUCKINGHAM AND SOUTHEASTERN AMHERST COUNTIES THROUGH 545 PM EDT... At 502 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Riverville, or near Amherst, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Amherst... Bent Creek... Stonewall... Tower Hill... Toga... Falconerville... and Riverville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
